page.title: 20Hellesdon Parish Council
page.content: Modern Parish council are elected bodies which have few powers and duties. Included are the following areas: allotments (some on Aylsham rd. near the airport), burial grounds, footway lighting, bus shelters, playing fields and village halls, community centres and public toilets. The Parish Council is composed of 15 members elected in 1984. The council has eight committees that council members are responsible for. These include: alloments, airports, emergency services, finance and general purposes, playing fields, planning and footpath's sub-committee. The council meets on the first tuesday of each month at the community centre at 7.30pm and public are allowed to attend and speak to the council. Local people and councillors have created a prospering and aware suburb.
